HTTPServer

public class HTTPServer: Server

An HTTP server that listens for connections on a socket.

  • delegate

    HTTP ServerDelegate.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public var delegate: ServerDelegate?
  • port

    Port number for listening for new connections.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public private(set) var port: Int?
  • state

    A server state.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public private(set) var state: ServerState = .unknown
  • sslConfig

    SSL cert configs for handling client requests

    Declaration

    Swift

    public var sslConfig: SSLService.Configuration?
  • listen(on:)

    Listens for connections on a socket

    Parameter

    Parameter on: port number for new connections (eg. 8090)

    Declaration

    Swift

    public func listen(on port: Int) throws

    Parameters

    on

    port number for new connections (eg. 8090)
  • listen(on:delegate:)

    Static method to create a new HTTPServer and have it listen for connections.

    Parameter

    Parameter on: port number for accepting new connections

    Parameter

    Parameter delegate: the delegate handler for HTTP connections

    Returns

    a new HTTPServer instance

    Declaration

    Swift

    public static func listen(on port: Int, delegate: ServerDelegate) throws -> HTTPServer

    Parameters

    on

    port number for accepting new connections
    delegate

    the delegate handler for HTTP connections

    Return Value

    a new HTTPServer instance

  • listen(port:errorHandler:)

    Listens for connections on a socket

    Parameter

    Parameter port: port number for new connections (eg. 8090)

    Parameter

    Parameter errorHandler: optional callback for error handling

    Declaration

    Swift

    public func listen(port: Int, errorHandler: ((Swift.Error) -> Void)? = nil)

    Parameters

    port

    port number for new connections (eg. 8090)
    errorHandler

    optional callback for error handling

    Static method to create a new HTTPServer and have it listen for connections.

    Returns

  • waitForListeners()

    Wait for all of the listeners to stop.

    Todo

    Note that this calls the ListenerGroup object, and is left in for backwards compability reasons. Can be safely removed once IBM-Swift/Kitura/Kitura.swift is patched to directly talk to ListenerGroup.
